intro: Hemicardion nephrolepis, commonly known as the common hemicardion, is a fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves that are typically light green and have a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called sori, which are located on the underside of the fronds. Hemicardion nephrolepis thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological studies.
